questions.question: Which functional group is characterized by the presence of a hydroxyl group ($-\text{OH}$) bonded to a saturated carbon atom?
questions.explanation: Alcohols contain the $-\text{OH}$ group, which significantly influences the molecule's polarity and boiling point.

questions.question: The carbonyl group consists of a carbon atom double-bonded to an oxygen atom ($\text{C}=\text{O}$). If this group is located at the **end** of a carbon chain, the molecule is a(n):
questions.explanation: Aldehydes have the carbonyl group at the terminal position, meaning the carbon is also bonded to at least one hydrogen atom ($-\text{CHO}$).

questions.question: Which functional group contains a nitrogen atom bonded to carbon atoms or hydrogen atoms?
questions.explanation: Amines are derivatives of ammonia ($\text{NH}_{3}$) where one or more hydrogen atoms are replaced by organic groups.

questions.question: An ester is formed by the reaction between an alcohol and which other functional group?
questions.explanation: Esters have the general formula $\text{R-COOR}'$ and are typically produced via the dehydration synthesis of a carboxylic acid and an alcohol.

questions.question: What is the name of the functional group consisting of an oxygen atom single-bonded to two carbon atoms ($\text{R-O-R}$)?
questions.explanation: Ethers feature an oxygen 'bridge' between two alkyl or aryl groups and are generally less reactive than alcohols.

questions.question: A carboxylic acid is identified by the presence of which group?
questions.explanation: The carboxyl group ($-\text{COOH}$) combines a carbonyl and a hydroxyl group on the same carbon atom.

questions.question: Which of the following describes a 'Ketone'?
options: A carbonyl group bonded to two carbon atoms
A carbonyl group bonded to a hydrogen atom
A hydroxyl group bonded to a benzene ring
questions.explanation: In ketones, the carbonyl carbon is internal to the chain, bonded to two other carbon atoms ($\text{R-CO-R}$).

questions.question: The functional group $-\text{CONH}_{2}$ is known as a(n):
questions.explanation: An amide contains a carbonyl group linked directly to a nitrogen atom.

questions.question: Which functional group is found in 'Thiols' (the sulfur analogs of alcohols)?
questions.explanation: Thiols (also called mercaptans) contain the sulfhydryl group ($-\text{SH}$), often noted for their strong odors.

questions.question: Halogenoalkanes (alkyl halides) contain a carbon atom bonded to:
options: A group 17 element (F, Cl, Br, or I)
questions.explanation: Alkyl halides are organic compounds where one or more hydrogen atoms have been replaced by a halogen atom.
